title: Knafeh
summary: Knafeh[3] (Arabic: كنافة‎) is a traditional Middle Eastern dessert made with spun pastry called kataifi,[4][5][6] soaked in sweet, sugar-based syrup, and typically layered with cheese, or with other ingredients such as clotted cream, pistachio or nuts, depending on the region.[1] It is popular in the Arab world, particularly Egypt and the Levant, being considered the most representative and iconic Palestinian dessert.[7][1][8][9][10][11] Variants are also found in Turkey, Greece, and the Balkans.[12]
